snippet: The F.B.I. seized papers and digital devices from Harold T. Martin III’s home in Maryland, but found no indication that he had passed classified information to anyone else....
abstract: Residents of Glen Burnie, Md, share their reactions to arrest of quiet neighbor Harold T Martin III; say they were surprised and concerned when large FBI team swarmed area in August and led Martin away in hand-cuffs; contractor, employed by Booz Allen Hamilton and working on National Security Agency projects, is accused of stealing classified government information.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS FANDOS and SCOTT SHANE
byline.contributor: Nicholas Fandos reported from Glen Burnie, Md., and Scott Shane from Baltimore. Reporting was contributed by Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, Jo Becker from New York and David E. Sanger from Cambridge, Mass. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The F.B.I. seized papers and digital devices from Harold T. Martin III’s home in Maryland, but found no indication that he had passed classified information to anyone else.

headline.main: A ‘Sad Case’ Suspect, Scared Pale as Police Swarmed His House in N.S.A. Case
headline.print_headline: A ‘Sad Case’ Suspect, Scared Pale as Police Swarmed His House

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
